author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Whirlwinds downed in overtime
text: slideshow When Drake Adkins hit the 1-yard line — that was it.It was the end of the first overtime. The Conway Junior Wampus Cats had scored a 2-point conversion on their possession, and the Russellville Whirlwinds needed to do the same to push the game to a second overtime.Adkins fell on the 1, and the Whirlwinds lost 22-20 on Thursday at Cyclone Stadium.The Whirlwinds (3-2, 2-1 River Valley Central Conference) went up 14-0 in the first half on a pair of touchdown passes to Bryson Kordsmeier. Russellville squandered its opening possession but pinned the Junior Wampus Cats deep in their own territory for good field position on the next Whirlwinds’ drive.RJHS took over on the Conway 35 and raced to the end zone in nine plays. Quarterback Rhett Atkins connecd with Kordsmeier from 19 yards out to put the Whirlwinds up 7-0 at the end of the first quarter.Russellville forced the Junior Wampus Cats to punt three plays later and went to work on its own 34-yard line. The Whirlwinds struck again eight plays later — this time with a 20-yard touchdown strike from Adkins to Kordsmeier to go up 14-0 after the successful PAT.Conway fumbled the ball two plays later to give Russellville another shot at the end zone with less than a minute left in the half. The Whirlwinds went to work on the Wampus Cats 37-yard line. Adkins threw two incomplete passes and was sacked with 32.9 seconds left. Adkins tore off 29 yards, but a holding penalty pushed the Whirlwinds further from the end zone. The half ended on a desperation pass to the end zone, which was fruitlessly picked off at the Russellville 1-yard line.The Whirlwinds outpaced the Junior Wampus cats with 121 yards of total offense in the first half compared to 23 and two turnovers by Conway. But by the end of the game, the Junior Wampus Cats had 248 yards offense to Russellville’s 230.Conway made it 14-7 with 32.0 left in the third quarter on a four-play, 67-yard drive.Russellville marched deep into Junior Wampus Cats territory, but was unable to punch it into the end zone. The Whirlwinds turned the ball over on downs with 3:37 left in the game. That was all Conway would need — two plays into its next drive the Wampus Cats scored on an 81-yard pass.Rhett Adkins finished the game with 121 yards on 20 carries. He was 14-of-25 for 86 yards and three touchdowns. Kordsmeier had 17 catches for 47 yards and three touchdowns.The Whirlwinds will host Cabot South on Thursday.
